summary: This bill, H.R. 1867, aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to eliminate the requirement for in-person visits for mental health services provided through telehealth and telecommunications technology under Medicare. The bill specifies the removal of geographic restrictions for substance use disorder treatment and mental health disorder diagnosis, evaluation, or treatment via telehealth. The bill also addresses mental health visits furnished by rural health clinics and federally qualified health centers, updating regulations.
